title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Build a complete CRUD API for Tasks!

1. Create 'TaskItem' class:
   - int Id
   - string Title
   - string Description
   - bool IsCompleted

2. Create in-memory list with 2 initial tasks

3. Implement ALL CRUD operations:
   - GET /api/tasks - Return all tasks
   - GET /api/tasks/{id} - Return single task
   - POST /api/tasks - Create new task (auto-assign ID)
   - PUT /api/tasks/{id} - Update task
   - DELETE /api/tasks/{id} - Delete task

4. For POST: use nextId counter for auto-incrementing IDs

5. Print available endpoints when API starts

hints.text: MapPost: 'app.MapPost(route, (Object obj) => ...)'. Assign ID before adding! MapPut: update properties one by one. MapDelete: .Remove() from list. Return proper Results: Created, Ok, NoContent, NotFound.
Not assigning ID in POST: Client shouldn't provide ID for new items! Server assigns it: 'task.Id = nextId++'. Then add to list. ID assignment is server's job!
Modifying wrong object in PUT: Don't modify 'updatedTask' parameter! Find existing item in list, then update ITS properties. Otherwise changes aren't persisted.
Forgetting to remove in DELETE: Must call 'list.Remove(item)'! Just returning NoContent() doesn't delete it. Actually remove from collection!
Using same route for different methods: Same route with different methods is FINE! GET /api/tasks and POST /api/tasks are different endpoints. Method matters, not just URL!
